alert.note: Alert for Northern Elko County; Southwest Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 2:54PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Elko County through 330 PM PDT... At 254 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Elko, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rainfall along with gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elko, Ryndon, Spring Creek, and Lamoille Summit. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM PDT for northeastern Nevada.

area.areaDesc: Northern Elko County; Southwest Elko County
